context: The Estonian word 'politseinik' means a police officer or policeman. It's formed from the root word 'politsei' (police) plus the suffix '-nik' which denotes an occupation or profession. This word refers to any member of the police force, and can be used in various compound forms like kriminaalpolitseinik (criminal detective), liikluspolitseinik (traffic cop), etc. The word is commonly used in everyday Estonian when referring to law enforcement personnel.
